description:
'''Kang Dae-sung''' ({{Korean|hangul=강대성}}; born April 26, 1989), better known mononymously as '''Daesung''' and his Japanese stage name '''D-Lite''', is a South Korean singer who made his musical debut in 2006 as a member of the South Korean [[boy band]] [[BigBang (South Korean band)|Big Bang]]. He debuted as a solo artist in South Korea with the number one [[trot (music)|trot]] song "Look at Me, Gwisoon" in 2008. Since the inception of the [[Circle Digital Chart|Gaon Digital Chart]] in 2010, Daesung achieved two Top 10 songs, the digital single "Cotton Candy" and "Wings" from the BigBang album ''[[Alive (BigBang EP)|Alive]]'' (2012).

In 2013, he released his first solo album in Japan, ''[[D'scover]]'' and embarked on his [[D'scover Tour|first Japanese tour]]. The following year, he released two more albums, ''[[D'slove]]'' and his first chart-topper, ''[[Delight (D-Lite EP)|Delight]]''. [[D'slove Tour]] made him the first Korean soloist to gather over 100,000 fans for two Japanese tours in a row. In 2017, he held his first solo Japanese dome tour, performing for over 150,000 people from four shows and released his second number one album, ''[[D-Day (D-Lite EP)|D-Day]]'', that made him the second foreign male solo artist to have two consecutive number one albums in Japan after [[Michael Jackson]].

In [[Television in South Korea|South Korean television]], he was a part of the main cast of the top-rated comedy show ''[[Family Outing]]'' from 2008 to 2010, the musical drama series ''[[What's Up (TV series)|What's Up]]'' (2011) and was one of the hosts of the talk show ''Night After Night'' (2010).
